title: @Riot KateyKhaos- Ace of Spades Ezreal hair color
body:
So with the upcoming cards-themed skins (which I really like), there's Ace of Spades Ezreal, and he went to the barber shop so many times, that his hair color in the splash doesn't really match the model anymore. :P
Will this be fixed before released? Maybe even in a later patch? Are you planning to fix this at all? I mean, I don't even mind if you'll change his hair back to brown (I liked all versions, basically), I just really want the splash's hair color to match the model's.
And before you say it's lighting... Well, it's just too dark to be the lighting (in the splash of course). :P

Thanks for taking time to read my post. :)

-_-

If anyone's looking for references:
http://i.gyazo.com/fd68841cd0df7b5f77b920498c1d15c8.png

replies.body: I'm not a fan of the super saiyin hair, honestly, and the striped shoulders were good detail.

Dear KateyKhaos and Giant,

I too share concerns over the current hair color of the in-game model vs. the splash-art. It is my personal opinion that the "earlier version" model's hair color looks the closet ( it looks like the same hair color hidden in shadow ) and I find that shade of brown to be a nice change from all the blonde/white-haired Ezreal skins we are used to seeing. More important to me though than this particular skin is the fact that Giant's point seems to be applicable to multiple champions released recently; one example being Sweetheart Annie who has an in-game model with hair so white I can't look at it while her splash art has her hair as light blonde. I'm sure this wasn't nearly as frequent as it used to be ( I'm aware of Woad Ashe's splash art having a dagger the game model lacks ) and can't think of many older examples that have such obvious differences but I'm hoping the teams who are responsible for the in-game and splash art begin coordinating more.

Thanks for taking the time to read my post,
fowus2happy.

Hey Mister Beane! 

In Sweetheart Annie's case, lighting in the splash was something that did lead to a bit of confusion when it came to what the in-game model looked like. There was some discussion around it, it's something the team does try to keep in mind when creating splash art for new skins.

With that said, we do try to keep the splash art as representative as possible to the in-game content as possible. However, there is a lot more we can do in splash as opposed to game - detail and lighting are two items that come to mind. 

We can be a lot more detailed in the splash art as opposed to in game. If we have the in-game model a ton of detail, the skin itself would look muddy because at game height, all of the details wouldn't be visible. 

Lighting is another instance where there's some variation, and that's due to the composition of the piece. The lighting in the splash will be different than the lighting in game (and it varies a tad depending on the map).

Unfortunately, we do not currently have an in-game model viewer, but we do have a model available on the [announcement page](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/skin-release/dark-path-forsaken-jayce-does-tread) when a skin is released, to show players what the skin looks like in game.

Hey katey, i know this may be weird that i'm saying this on someone elses post, but can you check out my champion concept and tell me what you think of it? and what needs work? i would REALLY REALLY APPRECIATE IT ;W; http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/sJJIq3gb-champion-concept-zhani-the-young-talentupdate

Hey DwarvenGiant! 

We don't have plans to make any more adjustments to Ace of Spades Ezreal's hair. 

Please keep in mind that the in game model will differ slightly from the splash art. In both instances, Ezreal does have blonde hair, and lighting is a factor in the splash art, as compared to the lighting in game.

Alright, fair enough. I'm just a little concerned that the splash might be a little misleading to some people, that it might make them think that the in-game is more towards brown hair rather than blonde. :P
Anyways, thanks for the response! :)
No worries, and I can honestly say when we had brown hair for the skin, the splash's hair color was much darker. ^-^

Still unsure why all the sudden, despite heavily changing iconic parts of champions for the sake a better skin, Riot is opting to go with something boring.

Before, you brought up how "Ezreal lacks in game reads" (which, frankly, giant glowing glove and a spell coming out every .5 seconds should be enough), and yet don't address the fact that not only does Lee Sin, who has just as few reads as Ezreal (or less) got his Dragon Fist Lee Sin skin which not only looks like an **entirely** different character, but has 3 chroma packs now.

Just a bit frustrated that we're getting a half-as-original skin because of reasons that Riot has ***definitely*** never shied away from in the past, and pretty obviously doesn't cause enough problems to be a major complaint amongst the community.
I still don't understand why he must always have blonde hair but the female champs get tons of hair-doo options .....disappointing really.

The real question is, is his hair/outfit combination black and blue, or white and gold?

.... ;)

The hair colour matches the splash art, it's just the shadow...

Just look at his shoulder pads, it's the same colour of the hair.

I preferred the first colour palette, where it was dark blue/blackish and darker overall.

With the changes, I'm no longer interested in purchasing it.

In my opinion, the blonde hair sticks out more and would be a lot better addition to the skin. This is because it goes with the trim of the clothes and it is his natural blonde hair. Cuz isn't Ezreal a blonde?
